member.name: T:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1
member.summary: The options for circuit breaker resilience strategy.
member.typeparam: The type of result the circuit breaker strategy handles.
member.remarks:
The circuit will break if, within any time-slice of duration , the proportion of actions resulting in a handled exception exceeds , provided also that the number of actions through the circuit in the time-slice is at least .
The circuit will stay broken for the . Any attempt to execute this while the circuit is broken, will immediately throw a containing the exception that broke the circuit.
If the first action after the break duration period results in a handled exception, the circuit will break again for another ; if no exception is thrown, the circuit will reset.

member.name: M:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.FailureRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the failure-to-success ratio at which the circuit will break.
member.remarks: A number between zero and one (inclusive) e.g. 0.5 represents breaking if 50% or more of actions result in a handled failure.
member.value: A ratio number higher than 0, up to 1. The default value is 0.1 (i.e. 10%).

member.name: P:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.MinimumThroughput
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum throughput: this many actions or more must pass through the circuit in the time-slice, for statistics to be considered significant and the circuit-breaker to come into action.
member.value: The default value is 100. The value must be 2 or greater.

member.name: P:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.SamplingDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of the sampling over which failure ratios are assessed.
member.value: The default value is 30 seconds. Value must be greater than 0.5 seconds.

member.name: P:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.BreakDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the duration of break the circuit will stay open before resetting.
member.value: The default value is 5 seconds. Value must be greater than 0.5 seconds.

member.name: P:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.BreakDurationGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional delegate to use to dynamically generate the break duration.

member.name: P:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.ShouldHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate that determines whether the outcome should be handled by the circuit breaker.
member.value: The default value is a predicate that handles circuit breaker on any exception except . This property is required.

member.name: P:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.OnClosed
member.summary: Gets or sets the event that is raised when the circuit resets to a state.
member.remarks:
The callbacks registered to this event are invoked with eventual consistency. There is no guarantee that the circuit breaker doesn't change the state before the callbacks finish. If you need to know the up-to-date state of the circuit breaker use the property.
Note that these events might be executed asynchronously at a later time when the circuit state is no longer the same as at the point of invocation of the event. However, the invocation order of the , , and events is always maintained to ensure the correct sequence of state transitions.

member.name: P:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitBreakerStrategyOptions`1.OnOpened
member.summary: Gets or sets the event that is raised when the circuit transitions to an state.
member.remarks:
The callbacks registered to this event are invoked with eventual consistency. There is no guarantee that the circuit breaker doesn't change the state before the callbacks finish. If you need to know the up-to-date state of the circuit breaker use the property.
Note that these events might be executed asynchronously at a later time when the circuit state is no longer the same as at the point of invocation of the event. However, the invocation order of the , , and events is always maintained to ensure the correct sequence of state transitions.

member.name: T:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitState
member.summary: Describes the possible states the circuit of a Circuit Breaker may be in.

member.name: F:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitState.Closed
member.summary: Closed - When the circuit is closed. Execution of actions is allowed.

member.name: F:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitState.Open
member.summary: Open - When the automated controller has opened the circuit (typically due to some failure threshold being exceeded by recent actions). Execution of actions is blocked.

member.name: F:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitState.HalfOpen
member.summary: Half-open - When the circuit is half-open, it is recovering from an open state. The duration of break of the preceding open state has typically passed. In the half-open state, actions may be executed, but the results of these actions may be treated with criteria different to normal operation, to decide if the circuit has recovered sufficiently to be placed back in to the closed state, or if continuing failures mean the circuit should revert to open perhaps more quickly than in normal operation.

member.name: F:Polly.CircuitBreaker.CircuitState.Isolated
member.summary: Isolated - When the circuit has been placed into a fixed open state by the isolate call. This isolates the circuit manually, blocking execution of all actions until a reset call is made.

member.name: T:Polly.Hedging.HedgingActionGeneratorArguments`1
member.summary: Represents arguments used in the hedging resilience strategy.
member.typeparam: The type of the result.
member.remarks:
The represents the context that was received by the hedging strategy and used to execute the primary action. To prevent race conditions, the hedging strategy then clones the primary context into and uses it to execute the hedged action. Every hedged action gets its own context that is cloned from the primary.
Always use the constructor when creating this struct, otherwise we do not guarantee binary compatibility.

member.remarks: The hedging is executed when the current attempt outcome is not successful and the predicate returns or when the current attempt did not finish within the .

member.name: T:Polly.Hedging.OnHedgingArguments`1
member.summary: Represents arguments used by the on-hedging event.
member.typeparam: The type of result.
member.remarks:
The represents the context that was received by the hedging strategy and used to execute the primary action. To prevent race conditions, the hedging strategy then clones the primary context into and uses it to execute the hedged action. Every hedged action gets its own context that is cloned from the primary.
Always use the constructor when creating this struct, otherwise we do not guarantee binary compatibility.

member.name: T:Polly.ResilienceContext
member.summary: A context assigned to a single execution of . It is created manually or automatically when the user calls the various extensions on top of . After every execution the context should be discarded and returned to the pool.
member.remarks: Do not re-use an instance of across more than one execution. The is retrieved from the pool by calling the method. After you are done with it you should return it to the pool by calling the method.

member.name: P:Polly.ResilienceContext.OperationKey
member.summary: Gets a key unique to the call site of the current execution.
member.remarks: Resilience context instances are commonly reused across multiple call sites. Set an so that logging and metrics can distinguish usages of policy instances at different call sites. The operation key value should have a low cardinality (i.e. do not assign values such as to this property).

member.name: M:Polly.Retry.RetryHelper.DecorrelatedJitterBackoffV2(System.Int32,System.TimeSpan,System.Double@,System.Func{System.Double})
member.summary: Generates sleep durations in an exponentially backing-off, jittered manner, making sure to mitigate any correlations. For example: 850ms, 1455ms, 3060ms. Per discussion in Polly issue https://github.com/App-vNext/Polly/issues/530, the jitter of this implementation exhibits fewer spikes and a smoother distribution than the AWS jitter formula.
member.param: The current attempt.

The median delay to target before the first retry, call it f (= f * 2^0). Choose this value both to approximate the first delay, and to scale the remainder of the series. Subsequent retries will (over a large sample size) have a median approximating retries at time f * 2^1, f * 2^2 ... f * 2^t etc for try t. The actual amount of delay-before-retry for try t may be distributed between 0 and f * (2^(t+1) - 2^(t-1)) for t >= 2; or between 0 and f * 2^(t+1), for t is 0 or 1.
The previous state value used for calculations.
The generator to use.
member.remarks: This code was adopted from https://github.com/Polly-Contrib/Polly.Contrib.WaitAndRetry/blob/master/src/Polly.Contrib.WaitAndRetry/Backoff.DecorrelatedJitterV2.cs.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the back-off.

member.name: P:Polly.Retry.RetryStrategyOptions`1.UseJitter
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether jitter should be used when calculating the backoff delay between retries.
member.remarks: See for more details on how jitter can improve the resilience when the retries are correlated.

member.name: P:Polly.Retry.RetryStrategyOptions`1.Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets the base delay between retries.
member.remarks:
This value is used with the combination of to generate the final delay for each individual retry attempt:
: Represents the median delay to target before the first retry.
: Represents the initial delay, the following delays increasing linearly with this value.
Represents the constant delay between retries.
This property is ignored when is set and returns a valid value.

member.name: P:Polly.Retry.RetryStrategyOptions`1.MaxDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum delay between retries.
member.remarks: This property is used to cap the maximum delay between retries. It is useful when you want to limit the maximum delay after a certain number of retries when it could reach a unreasonably high values, especially if backoff is used. If not specified, the delay is not capped. This property is ignored for delays generated by .

member.name: P:Polly.Retry.RetryStrategyOptions`1.ShouldHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets a predicate that determines whether the retry should be executed for a given outcome.
member.value: The default is a delegate that retries on any exception except . This property is required.

member.name: P:Polly.Retry.RetryStrategyOptions`1.DelayGenerator
member.summary: Gets or sets a generator that calculates the delay between retries.
member.remarks: The generator can override the delay generated by the retry strategy. If the generator returns , the delay generated by the retry strategy for that attempt will be used.

member.name: P:Polly.Retry.RetryStrategyOptions`1.OnRetry
member.summary: Gets or sets an event delegate that is raised when the retry happens.
member.remarks: After this event, the result produced the by user-callback is discarded and disposed to prevent resource over-consumption. If you need to preserve the result for further processing, create the copy of the result or extract and store all necessary information from the result within the event.

member.name: P:Polly.Retry.RetryStrategyOptions`1.Randomizer
member.summary: Gets or sets the randomizer that is used by the retry strategy to generate random numbers.
member.value: The default value is thread-safe randomizer that returns values between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that certain members on a specified are accessed dynamically, for example through .
member.remarks:
This allows tools to understand which members are being accessed during the execution of a program.
This attribute is valid on members whose type is or .
When this attribute is applied to a location of type , the assumption is that the string represents a fully qualified type name.
When this attribute is applied to a class, interface, or struct, the members specified can be accessed dynamically on instances returned from calling on instances of that class, interface, or struct.
If the attribute is applied to a method it's treated as a special case and it implies the attribute should be applied to the "this" parameter of the method. As such the attribute should only be used on instance methods of types assignable to System.Type (or string, but no methods will use it there).

member.summary: Gets or sets the scope of the code that is relevant for the attribute.
member.remarks: The Scope property is an optional argument that specifies the metadata scope for which the attribute is relevant.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets a fully qualified path that represents the target of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument identifying the analysis target of the attribute. An example value is "System.IO.Stream.ctor():System.Void". Because it is fully qualified, it can be long, particularly for targets such as parameters. The analysis tool user interface should be capable of automatically formatting the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument expanding on exclusion criteria.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument that specifies additional exclusion where the literal metadata target is not sufficiently precise. For example, the cannot be applied within a method, and it may be desirable to suppress a violation against a statement in the method that will give a rule violation, but not against all statements in the method.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Justification
member.summary: Gets or sets the justification for suppressing the code analysis message.
